author: William F Hall
title: William F. Hall Obituary - Courier Press
text:
Let your community know
Let the family know you are thinking of them
Hear your loved one's obituary
William “Bill” Hall, 71, of St. Wendel, passed away unexpectedly on Sunday, February 16, 2025, in Clarksville, Tennessee while driving home after six weeks in his favorite place, Marco Island, Florida. We are all deeply saddened and shocked by his sudden death.
Bill was born on October 19, 1953, in Evansville to the late Jack and Shirley (Weiberg) Hall. He retired from Millwright Local 1080. Bill made friends easily and had a routine of making his rounds at the local watering holes to visit his buddies. Those who knew Bill will remember him being easy going and never in a hurry. His motto was “never do today what you can put off until tomorrow”.
Surviving Bill are his wife of 47 years, Shirley; brother, John Hall; his in-laws, many nieces and nephews.
To honor Bill’s wishes there will be no public visitation or funeral services held. Please celebrate Bill’s memory privately, in your own way. We know he will be with us all in spirit. Thank you for your understanding and support in this difficult time.
Condolences may be made online at www.pierrefuneralhome.com.
Posted online on February 20, 2025
Published in The Evansville Courier & Press
